etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in The Public Advertiser. Alteration (with suffix substitution: see -fication) of impersonation, after personification

definitions: The action or an act of representing or imagining an immaterial thing or abstract quality as a person or being; personification. Also: an example of this; the personification or embodiment of a particular quality, idea, etc.
The action or an act of pretending to be someone else, usually for the purpose of entertainment or fraud; (in early use especially) the acting of a role in a play, etc.
